questions.question: You will not get the promotion …………………… you deserve it.
We have lived in this city ……………………….. ten years.
The child has been missing …………………………. yesterday.
questions.description: We use since with the starting point.

questions.question: He accused me ………………………. stealing his ideas.
She ………………………….. from high school in
questions.description: We use the simple past when we say when something happened.

questions.question: You will get well …………………………. you take enough rest.
The boy along with his parents …………………………. waiting there.
questions.description: When you connect two nouns with along with the verb agrees with the first subject.

questions.question: We …………………………… English for six months.
questions.description: The present perfect continuous is used to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: When ………………...…………. yesterday?
questions.description: In the simple past, questions and negatives are made with did.

questions.question: He ………………………….. ill for more than a week.
Neither James nor Peter ………………………… there.
questions.description: When we connect two singular nouns with neither/nor, the verb is singular.
